documents.name: Privacy Policy
documents.text:
slither.io privacy policy Our servers log very basic information about each computer connecting to our site, such as IP address, device characteristics, and browser type. None of this information is associated with any identified person at the time it is collected, but it could potentially be tied to you somehow if we are required to disclose our server logs as a result of a subpoena or other legal process.

We may use cookies, web beacons, or other anonymous tracking information to improve our server's interaction with your computer. Third party vendors, including Google, also use cookies to serve ads to you based on your visit to this site and/or other sites on the Internet.

You may opt out of the use of Google's ad-related cookies by visiting their ad settings.

For more information regarding opting out of a third party vendor's use of cookies, you can visit aboutads.info.

We may occasionally revise our privacy policy by posting the changes here.

points.title: Third party cookies are employed, but with opt out instructions
points.quoteText:
Third party vendors, including Google, also use cookies to serve ads to you based on your visit to this site and/or other sites on the Internet.

You may opt out of the use of Google's ad-related cookies by visiting their ad settings.

points.title: You are tracked via web beacons, tracking pixels, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting
points.quoteText: We may use cookies, web beacons, or other anonymous tracking information to improve our server's interaction with your computer.

points.title: The service makes critical changes to its terms without user involvement
points.status: The privacy can be revised, but there is nothing about notifying users about changes.
points.quoteText: We may occasionally revise our privacy policy by posting the changes here.

points.title: Site uses first-party cookies, web beacons, and other anonymous tracking information
points.status: The privacy policy states that "We may use cookies, web beacons, or other anonymous tracking information to improve our server's interaction with your computer. " This makes sense when you consider the fact that slither.io is an MMO; it makes sense for the serivce to track its players to an extent. The game also tracks the last skin you used, which is probably where the cookies come in.  It's not specified how using trackers to collect information is expected to improve server interactions however.

points.title: third-party cookies, but with opt-out instructions
points.status: third-party cookies, but with opt-out instructions

points.title: Servers could be used to identify players
points.status: The privacy policy states, "Our servers log very basic information about each computer connecting to our site, such as IP address, device characteristics, and browser type. None of this information is associated with any identified person at the time it is collected, but it could potentially be tied to you somehow if we are required to disclose our server logs as a result of a subpoena or other legal process." In other words, the policy says slither.io is unable to identify it's players, but its servers could be used to identify them if they are forced to. In my opinion, I do not think this is a bad idea since users are still kept anonymous but their information can be used to solve crimes (possibly a rare situation, but still possible).
points.quoteText:
Our servers log very basic information about each computer connecting to our site, such as IP address, device characteristics, and browser type.
None of this information is associated with any identified person at the time it is collected, but it could potentially be tied to you somehow if we are required to disclose our server logs as a result of a subpoena or other legal process.
